🌪 Streams in the Desert - April 23 🌊

"Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me" ✝️ (Ps. 138:7)

The Hebrew says "go on in the center of trouble." What powerful words! We pray in trouble, beg God for help... but no help comes. The enemy keeps attacking until we're right in the middle of the battle, in the worst part of our troubles. Why keep asking God for help?

When Martha said, "Lord, if you had been here, my brother wouldn't have died," Jesus answered her hopelessness with promise: "Your brother will rise again." When we're "in the center of trouble" like Martha—thinking it's too late for help—God meets us with the same promise: "Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me."

Even when God's answer seems late... Even when we must keep going through trouble... The center of trouble is where God revives us—not where He fails us. When all seems hopeless—exactly then—God moves against our enemies and finishes what concerns us. Right then, He stops the attacks.

So why lose heart?

🌪 THE EYE OF THE STORM 🌤

Don't fear the whirlwind will sweep you away,
Don't wait in fear for its coming day,
Don't shrink from hail that may sting and may flail,
But move to the storm's heart—through the gale.
There's shelter warm where the sunlight streams,
Faith sees her God in the storm's center beams.

🌊 The wild tempest may roar at your door,
Waves tower like mountains, rains flood and pour,
Yet the soul stayed on God sings loud and strong,
For the storm's fierce heart is where calm belongs.

✨ Let hope stay bright through the blackest night,
Though cyclones may hide all stars from your sight,
Behind the dark curtain, God's stars still shine,
His heavenly light will forever be thine.
Lift up your eyes past the gloom and the harm,
To God's smiling face—and the sky's blue calm.

🛡 The storm is your shelter from sin and from fear,
God takes you inside where He holds you near.
The tempest grows still at His gentle command,
The howling winds become hymns sweet and grand.
Rejoice when storm clouds their dark wings unfold—
God smiles on His child in the storm's eye-hold.

—Aphra White
